name: ionic
description: The Ionic command-line interface (CLI) is the go-to tool for developing Ionic apps.

name: --engine
options.description: Target engine (e.g. browser, cordova)

name: --platform
options.description: Target platform on chosen engine (e.g. ios, android)

name: --browser
-w
options.description: Specifies the browser to use (safari, firefox, google chrome)

name: --json
options.description: Print system/environment info in JSON format

name: --type
options.description: Type of project (e.g. angular, react, vue, custom)

name: --force
-f
options.description: Initialize even if a project already exists

name: --multi-app
options.description: Initialize a multi-app project

name: --project-id
options.description: Specify a slug for your app

name: --default
options.description: Mark the initialized app as the default project

args.name: name
args.description: The name of your project (e.g. myApp, "My App")

args.name: id
args.description: The Appflow ID of the app to link (e.g. a1b2c3d4)

args.name: email
args.description: Your email address

args.name: password
args.description: Your password

name: --cordova
options.description: Only perform the repair steps for Cordova platforms and plugins.

name: --external
options.description: Host dev server on all network interfaces (i.e. --host=0.0.0.0)

name: --host
options.description: Use specific host for the dev server

name: --port
-p
options.description: Use specific port for the dev server

name: --public-host
options.description: The host used for the browser or web view

name: --livereload
options.description: Do not spin up dev server--just serve files

name: --lab-host
options.description: Use specific host for Ionic Lab server

name: --lab-port
options.description: Use specific port for Ionic Lab server

name: --open
options.description: Do not open a browser window

name: --browser
-w
options.description: Specifies the browser to use (safari, firefox, google chrome)

name: --browseroption
-o
options.description: Specifies a path to open to (/#/tab/dash)

name: --lab
-l
options.description: Test your apps on multiple platform types in the browser

name: --list
-l
options.description: List available starter templates

name: --type
options.description: Type of project to start (e.g. vue, angular, react, ionic-angular, ionic1)

name: --cordova
options.description: Include Cordova integration

name: --capacitor
options.description: Include Capacitor integration

name: --deps
options.description: Do not install npm/yarn dependencies

name: --git
options.description: Do not initialize a git repo

name: --link
options.description: Connect your new app to Ionic

name: --id
options.description: Specify an Ionic App ID to link

name: --project-id
options.description: Specify a slug for your app (used for the directory name and package name)

name: --package-id
options.description: Specify the bundle ID/application ID for your app (reverse-DNS notation)

args.name: name
args.description: The name of your new project (e.g. myApp, "My App")

args.name: template
args.description: The starter template to use (e.g. blank, tabs; use --list to see all)

name: --global
-g
options.description: Use global CLI config

name: --json
options.description: Output config values in JSON

name: --root
options.description: Operate on root of ionic.config.json

args.name: property
args.description: The property name you wish to get

name: --global
-g
options.description: Use global CLI config

name: --json
options.description: Always interpret value as JSON

name: --force
options.description: Always overwrite existing values

name: --root
options.description: Operate on root of ./ionic.config.json

args.name: property
args.description: The property name you wish to set

args.name: value
args.description: The new value of the given property

name: --global
-g
options.description: Use global CLI config

name: --root
options.description: Operate on root of ./ionic.config.json

args.name: property
args.description: The property name you wish to delete

args.name: platform
args.description: The platform to add (e.g. android, ios)

options.description: Do not invoke Ionic build

options.description: Do not invoke Capacitor open

args.description: The platform to build for (e.g. android, ios)

args.description: The platform to copy (e.g. android, ios)

options.description: List all available targets

options.description: Deploy to a specific device by its ID (use --list to see all)

options.description: Open native IDE instead of using capacitor run

name: --build
options.description: Do not invoke Ionic build

options.description: Host dev server on all network interfaces (i.e. --host=0.0.0.0)

args.description: The platform to sync (e.g. android, ios)

name: --app-id
options.description: Your Appflow app ID

name: --channel-name
options.description: The channel to check for updates from

name: --update-method
options.description: The update method that dictates the behavior of the plugin

name: --max-store
options.description: The maximum number of downloaded versions to store on the device

name: --min-background-duration
options.description: The minimum duration after which the app checks for an update in the background

name: --environment
options.description: The group of environment variables exposed to your build

name: --channel
options.description: The channel you want to auto deploy the build to. This can be repeated multiple times if multiple channels need to be specified.

name: --commit
options.description: Commit (defaults to HEAD)

name: --skip-download
options.description: Skip downloading build artifacts after command succeeds.

options.description: Your Appflow app ID

options.description: Commit (defaults to HEAD)

name: --build-stack
options.description: Target platform ("Android", "iOS - Xcode 11 (Preferred)", "iOS - Xcode 10")

options.description: The name for the downloaded build file

args.name: platform
args.description: The platform to package (android, ios)

args.name: type
args.description: The build type (debug, release, development, ad-hoc, app-store, enterprise)

args.name: build-id
args.description: The build id of the desired successful package build

args.name: destination
args.description: The destination to deploy the build artifact to the app store

name: --key-path
options.description: Destination of private key file

name: --cert-path
options.description: Destination of certificate file

name: --country-name
options.description: The country name (C) of the SSL certificate

name: --state-or-province-name
options.description: The state or province name (ST) of the SSL certificate

name: --locality-name
options.description: The locality name (L) of the SSL certificate

name: --organization-name
options.description: The organization name (O) of the SSL certificate

name: --common-name
options.description: The common name (CN) of the SSL certificate

name: --bits
-b
options.description: Number of bits in the key

name: --use
options.description: Use the newly added key as your default SSH key for Ionic

args.name: pubkey-path
args.description: Location of public key file to add to Ionic

args.name: key-id
args.description: The ID of the public key to delete

name: --type
-t
options.description: The type of key to generate: ecdsa, ed25519, rsa

name: --bits
-b
options.description: Number of bits in the key

name: --annotation
-C
options.description: Annotation (comment) in public key. Your Ionic email address will be used

args.name: key-path
args.description: Destination of private key file

name: --json
options.description: Output SSH keys in JSON

args.description: Location of private key file to use
